alert.note: Alert for Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 11 at 10:00PM EST until March 12 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 10 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...1 to 2 feet and locally up to 3 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Soundside locations of the Northern Outer Banks, including Manteo and Colington Island. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 10 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...1 to 2 feet, locally up to 3 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in some areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in an elevated threat of property damage. Flooding will extend inland from the waterfront threatening some homes and businesses. Numerous road closures and flooding of vehicles will be possible. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Oregon Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.4 ft, Moderate 3.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 11/08 PM 0.7 0.1 0.6 1 None 12/02 PM 4.0 3.4 3.8 3 Minor 13/04 AM 1.4 0.8 1.0 2-3 None 13/05 PM 0.7 0.1 0.4 1 None 14/05 AM 0.7 0.1 0.2 1 None 14/07 PM 0.6 -0.0 0.2 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
